translation: He to whom censure and praise are equal, who is silent, content with anything, homeless, of a steady mind, and full of devotion; that man is dear to me.
commentary: 12.19 Tulyanindastutih to whom censure and praise are eal? Mauni -- silent? satisfied contented? Yenkenchit with anything? Homeless homeless? steadyminded? devout full of devotion? Me to Me? Dear: dear? Narah (that) man.Commentary He is neither elated by praise nor pained by censure. He keeps a balanced state of mind. He has controlled the organ of speech and so he is silent.
